Posted By: themlsna (6/5/2010 6:38:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It really says something about this card's badness when you see how much he changed for the planar chaos version compared to the others.  
  
Crovax- Gets +1/+1 and a pay 2 life: bounce him ability, loses flying (since he isn't a vampire anymore)  
Braids- Puts cards onto the battlefield instead of sacing them  
Akroma- Colorshifted protections, Trades haste, first strike, and vigilance for uncounterable, morph and firebreathing  
Mirri- P/T switched, Gains flying instead of forestwalk and haste instead of vigilance, and gets the traditional vampire feeding ability for +1 CMC  
Jedit- Loses 1 cmc, gains forestwalk and the ability to make 2/2 forestwalking cat tokens whenever he attacks or blocks.
posts.html:
It really says something about this card's badness when you see how much he changed for the planar chaos version compared to the others.

Crovax- Gets +1/+1 and a pay 2 life: bounce him ability, loses flying (since he isn't a vampire anymore)
Braids- Puts cards onto the battlefield instead of sacing them
Akroma- Colorshifted protections, Trades haste, first strike, and vigilance for uncounterable, morph and firebreathing
Mirri- P/T switched, Gains flying instead of forestwalk and haste instead of vigilance, and gets the traditional vampire feeding ability for +1 CMC
Jedit- Loses 1 cmc, gains forestwalk and the ability to make 2/2 forestwalking cat tokens whenever he attacks or blocks.

posts.post_content:
This card rocks to have in your binder almost as much as it sucks to have in your deck. LOL Legends for turning logic on its head like that! xD  
  
But seriously, Jedit Ojanen deserves a bit more love, soooo....  
Here's some new flavor text:  
  
"Walking through forests of palm tree apartments ---  
 scoff at the monkeys who live in their dark tents  
 down by the waterhole --- drunk every Friday ---  
 eating their nuts --- saving their raisins for Sunday.  
 Lions and tigers who wait in the shadows ---  
 they're fast but they're lazy, and sleep in green meadows.  
Well Let's **BUNGLE IN THE JUNGLE**! Well that's *ALL RIGHT! BY ME!*"

posts.post_content: If nothing else. . . he's multicolored for [Knight of New Alara](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of New Alara), is a cat for [Raksha Golden Cub](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raksha Golden Cub), is power 5 or greater for various Naya themed cards in Shards of Alara block, has his cost reduced by [Grand Arbiter Augustin IV](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grand Arbiter Augustin IV), and being a legend counts for various nice cards from Kamigawa. He's like a balanced version of [Storm Crow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Storm Crow). That card is way OP.
posts.html:

He's like a balanced version of Storm Crow. That card is way OP.

Posted By: DlCK (10/21/2012 2:51:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
One of those Legends that so badly needs an ability to match the coolness of the flavor.  
  
I sometimes wonder if they just ran out of time when making that set... Why make a set full of supposedly epic "Legends" that helped shape the game world, and then make so many of them boring, overcosted lumps that lack abilities. I can understand why they were overpriced - almost all creatures were back then - but how does "Amazing cat warrior" equal "blank text box 5/5 for 7 mana of two colors?!"  
  
Heck, at least give him Plainswalk or something, as random as that would be.
posts.html:
One of those Legends that so badly needs an ability to match the coolness of the flavor.

I sometimes wonder if they just ran out of time when making that set... Why make a set full of supposedly epic "Legends" that helped shape the game world, and then make so many of them boring, overcosted lumps that lack abilities. I can understand why they were overpriced - almost all creatures were back then - but how does "Amazing cat warrior" equal "blank text box 5/5 for 7 mana of two colors?!"

Heck, at least give him Plainswalk or something, as random as that would be.
